agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE RURAL DEVELOPMENT - INDIANA
agency_desc: A federal government agency responsible for issues related development and revitalization in rural Indiana by financing home buyers and rehabilitation projects.
site_name: USDA RURAL DEVELOPMENT - NORTH VERNON AREA
service_name: SINGLE FAMILY HOUSING HOME REPAIR LOANS - NORTH VERNON AREA OFFICE
service_description: Offers loans to eligible applicants to purchase homes in eligible rural areas.  Offers a loan to eligible rural homeowners for modifications needed to make their home accessible or remove health and safety hazards. Maximum loan amount is $20,000, with a 1% interest rate. There is a $10,000 lifetime limit on grant funds for eligible seniors, 62 and older,. Grant recipients must repay if home is sold during first three years.
site_details: Call for information or to receive application.
site_eligibility: Living in eligible rural area in Bartholomew, Brown, Clark, Dearborn, Decatur, Floyd, Franklin, Jackson, Jennings, Jefferson, Johnson, Lawrence, Morgan, Ohio, Ripley, Rush, Scott, Shelby, or Switzerland County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

Living in eligible rural area in  Bartholomew, Brown, Clark, Dearborn, Decatur, Floyd, Franklin, Jackson,  Jefferson, Jennings, Johnson, Lawrence, Morgan, Ohio, Ripley, Rush, Scott, Shelby, and Switzerland County -- US Citizen or permanent resident -- Own and occupy home -- Low income (limits vary by county) -- Satisfactory credit history

agency_desc: Provides water services to rural areas.
service_description: Provides water service to rural areas of Jennings County.
site_details: Call for assistance. -- Bills may be paid in person, by mail, by phone, or automatic withdrawal from bank account; a drop box is available at this location.
site_eligibility: Living in service area

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of North Vernon in Jennings County.
service_description: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of North Vernon in Jennings County. Responds to questions, complaints, and requests regarding city government and services.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of North Vernon in Jennings County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of North Vernon in Jennings County.
service_description: Provides street and sidewalk maintenance, storm-sewer maintenance, snow and ice control, dead animal pick-up, street-sign maintenance, trash and debris pickup, and grounds keeping of public properties in the city of North Vernon in Jennings County.
site_details: Call for information, to submit a request, or make a report.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of North Vernon in Jennings County

agency_desc: Provides governance and municipal services for the city of North Vernon in Jennings County.
service_description: Maintains and provides information about public park facilities and programming in the city of North Vernon in Jennings County. Programs vary by season, but may include team sports, summer youth clubs, and after-school programs.
site_details: Walk in to visit the parks; call or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: City/County Parks
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Parks: Daily dawn to dusk, unless otherwise noted

site_eligibility: Parks are open to all; some programs may have specific requirements

agency_desc: Promotes and protects public safety and animal care through sheltering, pet placement programs, education, and animal law enforcement.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances in Jennings County, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services and adoption for homeless dogs and cats.
site_details: Walk in or call for information. For after-hour reporting of an animal control emergency call the Jennnings County Dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: River Metals Recycling makes a profound impact in the scrap recycling industry and is one of the first publicly traded waste and recycling companies in the United States.
site_name: RIVER METALS RECYCLING - NORTH VERNON RECYCLING LOCATION
service_description: Provides recycling services and collects scrap iron, automotive scrap, steel rims, pipes, cast iron, machinery, beams, steel turnings, automobiles, copper tubing, aluminum wheels, transmissions, and more.
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry, including disaster services.
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Limit to two visits, one visit every 15 days -- Low income
Open; financial need
Vicitm of fire -- Able to provide documentation of fire
Open

agency_desc: Provides water service to the Hayden area and parts of North Vernon in Jennings County.
service_description: Provides water service to the Hayden area and parts of North Vernon in Jennings County.
site_details: Call or walk in for assistance. Bills may be paid in person, by mail, or by phone; a drop box is located at this address.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
service_description: Offers activities for older adults, including special interest classes, social activities, travel, and field trips.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Age 55 or older
Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A government service providing planning, zoning, and building services for Jennings County. Services include new construction, zoning, variances, building permits, and code enforcement.
service_description: Oversees housing and commercial development and enforces zoning ordinances for Jennings County. This department issues permits and conducts inspections for construction and remodeling projects, responds to reports of overgrown weeds on private property, and handles zoning requests, complaints, and appeals.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Services
site_details: Call for more information
site_eligibility: Jennings County residents

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. Provides student transportation services and maintains information on school locations, enrollment, fees, and curricula. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Offers classes for adult basic education and HSE (High School Equivalency). English as a Second Language is also offered when available. Delivers education tailored to the nontraditional learner.
site_details: Must take and pass a TABE test (Test of Adult Basic Education). Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Individuals age 16 and older -- Individuals that are 16 and 17 years old are required to have parental permission, withdrawal letter from public school, and latest copy of transcripts -- Must have 12 hours of previous education

agency_desc: The primary functions of the County Assessor's Office are assessment of real and personal property for Jennings County, real estate and personal property appeals, non taxable exemptions, and appeals.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Jennings County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on boundaries and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information
site_eligibility: Jennings County residents

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including financial assistance.
service_description: Provides up to $100 of assistance for electric, natural gas, water, or rent to people in need. Participants must attend a church service and complete five hours of volunteer work with a partner agency.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Living in Jennings County -- Not received financial assistance from this agency within the last 6 months -- Complete five hours of volunteer work -- Attend a church service

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing services to older adults and those with disabilities in Bartholomew, Brown, Decatur, Jackson, and Jennings Counties. Serves as Indiana's Area 11 Agency on Aging for south central Indiana.
service_name: MEAL SITE - NORTH VERNON SENIOR HOUSING
service_description: Provides a hot nutritious, sit-down lunch and fellowship for older adults age 60 or older. Reservations at least 24 hours prior are appreciated but not required.
site_details: Call 24 hours in advance to reserve a meal.

site_schedule.name: Congregate Meals/Nutrition Sites
site_schedule.schedule: Reservations: Mon-Fri 9am-1pm -- Meal Times: Vary by location

site_eligibility: Living in Bartholomew, Brown, Decatur, Jackson, or Jennings County -- Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information and referral, including a food pantry.
service_description: Provides nonperishable food, meat, bread, and milk vouchers to people in need. People MUST have a referral from contracted township trustee. Contracted township trustees include Bigger, Campbell, Columbia, Geneva, Lovett, and Montgomery.
site_details: Call for information. -- Contact your trustee for a referral.
site_eligibility: Living in Jennings County -- Low income, elderly, or disabled persons -- MUST have referral from contracted township trustee
Living in Jennings County

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information Daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Jennings County
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county
Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: Responsible for property taxes in Jennings County.
service_description: Collects taxes and in the case of delinquent taxes may order the sale of real property to pay delinquent taxes. Receives distributions of local income and other taxes that are collected by the state such as real estate tax, personal property tax, mobile home tax, state assessed tax, and the following miscellaneous taxes: auto excise tax, inheritance tax, and innkeeper's tax.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Jennings County properties

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Provides routine health and safety inspections and investigates complaints against restaurants, grocery stores, and other food service establishments in the County. Provides consultation and licensing for retail food service vendors and food safety education for individuals, health fairs, and community groups.
site_details: Call to make a complaint about licensed food service establishments in the County or for details about licensing or food safety programs.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; Open
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Open
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County
Open -- Age 6 months and older

Open -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Age 19 or older -- Open
Varies by service; call for details.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Jennings County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Jennings County

To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Jennings County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library and provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Most in-house services, including computer stations: Open -- To check out materials: Library card

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility forJennings County .
service_description: Maintains the Jennings County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: Must be age 18 or older to visit or accompanied by someone over 18

agency_desc: Offers a full-service hospital providing a wide range of diagnostic, treatment, and health care programs, including 24-hour emergency care.
service_description: Provides education for youth and adults on tobacco prevention. Also supports individuals who want to quit tobacco through local cessation programs.

agency_desc: A government agency offering recycling services.
site_name: SOUTHEASTERN INDIANA RECYCLING DISTRICT - JENNINGS COUNTY
service_description: Provides a drop-off center for recycling paper, cardboard, newspapers, magazines, plastic bottles and jugs (#1-#2), glass, and aluminum/steel cans. This site also has a reuse center where donations of working equipment/tools, household appliances and goods, clothing, books, toys, and other items are offered to anyone at no charge.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information. -- Walk in to drop off approved recyclables. -- Walk in to browse available items in reuse center; take whatever is needed.

agency_desc: A community mental health agency offering consultation and treatment. Outpatient, case management, therapy, residential, vocational, medical, group, and day programs are available.
service_name: OUTPATIENT MENTAL HEALTH CARE - NORTH VERNON
service_description: Offers outpatient mental health and addiction services for persons of all ages. Programs include general counseling for individuals and families, anger management, psychiatric disorder treatment, substance abuse assessment and counseling, and intensive outpatient programs (IOP). A 24-hour intake and crisis intervention line is available. Persons in crisis may also receive walk-in services during normal business hours.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call Access Line for intake assessment or to make an appointment. -- For crisis intervention, walk in during normal business hours or call the Crisis Line at any time.

agency_desc: Government agency that operates a 24-hour 911 emergency dispatch service.
service_description: Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and ambulances in Jennings County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the 24-hour, nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Jennings County

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Jennings County.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Jennings County, including performing the following duties: Controls, maintains, and supervises county property -- Audits and authorizes claims against the county -- Receives bids for and authorizes county contracts -- Performs certain election functions -- Handles appeals of township trustee decisions
site_details: Call for assistance.

site_schedule.name: General Relief Appeals/Complaints
site_schedule.schedule: Office:  Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 2nd and 3rd Thurs 6:30pm

site_schedule.name: Local Officials Offices
site_schedule.schedule: Office:  Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Board Meetings: 2nd and 3rd Thurs 6:30pm

site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Jennings County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways.
site_details: Call for information or to report a problem. To report urgent problems after hours, call 9-1-1 or Jennings County dispatch.
site_eligibility: Open (limited to county roads and properties in Jennings County)

agency_desc: A city-government law enforcement agency.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the city of North Vernon in Jennings County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For non-emergency services, call the office during business hours or call North Vernon City Dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the city of North Vernon in Jennings County

agency_desc: Provides emergency fire and medical services for the city of North Vernon in Jennings County.
service_description: Provides free smoke alarms to household in need, when funds are available.
site_details: Call for information and availability.
site_eligibility: Living in North Vernon -- Homeowners -- Financial need
Open; responds to emergency situations in the city of North Vernon

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURT JENNINGS COUNTY - CIRCUIT COURT
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Jennings County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves. For juror information, contact the court.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURT JENNINGS COUNTY CIRCUIT COURT - PROBATION
service_description: Provides probation services for the Jennings County Superior Court, including supervising adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for information.
site_eligibility: Offenders assigned to probation by the Jennings County Courts

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
site_name: INDIANA STATE COURT JENNINGS COUNTY - SUPERIOR COURT
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Call or walk in to the County Clerk's office for claim forms.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older -- With a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Jennings County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Jennings County -- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Jennings County
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Maintains land mapping and boundaries congruent with the best interests of the county and its citizens through section cornerstones, maintaining the county regulated drain system, and field surveying as necessary.
service_description: Provides the following county services: maintains section corners; files legal surveys; maintains voter precinct maps, annexation, and de-annexation; investigates drainage obstructions; and researches and documents all cemeteries in Jennings County.
nameLevel3: Land Use Planning and Regulation Bodies
site_details: Call for service
site_eligibility: Jennings County properties
